Chelsea's opening goal against Watford, albeit a stunner, should not have counted.

Everyone could see on the television replays that after Miguel Britos and Eden Hazard jostled for possession on the touchline, the ball hit the Belgian's heel and ran off for what should have been a goal-kick.

However, the assistant referee, just metres away, dithered, appearing not to have watched what happened right in front of him, and eventually signalled for a corner.

Watford protested, Hazard played it short to Pedro and the Spaniard cracked a delicious effort in off Heurelho Gomes' far post.


And former referee Dermot Gallagher has condemned the decision to award a corner kick in his Ref Watch feature for Sky Sports. He said the linesman had suffered a "lapse in concentration".

Gallagher said: "It should have been a goal-kick. We're not talking about a decision here, we're talking about consequences of decisions. It was a momentary lapse in concentration, the linesman doesn't see the ball strike Hazard, it should have been a goal-kick."

MON 23 OCT 2017

Emma Hayes has signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract with Chelsea Ladies FC.

The announcement comes with the Blues having made a perfect start to the Women’s Super League (WSL) campaign as well as progressing past Bayern Munich into the last 16 of the UEFA Women’s Champions League.
